openstack%2Fneutron~stable%2Fpike~Ia26b4d1995690e7291b6476dc683271e12de09ab,openstack/neutron,stable/pike,bug/1714528,Ia26b4d1995690e7291b6476dc683271e12de09ab,fix missing l2pop config option docs,MERGED,2017-10-23 15:50:17.000000000,2017-10-24 12:58:03.000000000,2017-10-24 12:58:02.000000000,5,2,0,514367,7c07dc1276bb23935b3c06f8b94f656bb424006d,9,6,1,2,21798,Bernard Cafarelli,bcafarel,fix missing l2pop config option docs
The l2pop ML2 mechanism driver's configuration options are no longer

(cherry picked from commit 1b4559a5e498eac31d051ba5d1c5a86597588560)

openstack%2Fopenstack-ansible-os_horizon~master~I2ed050f5f9bfe2f5a6fbbe83f421a0d5eaa3dedc,openstack/openstack-ansible-os_horizon,master,zuulv3-jobs,I2ed050f5f9bfe2f5a6fbbe83f421a0d5eaa3dedc,Remove unified queue from gate pipeline,MERGED,2017-10-23 10:20:23.000000000,2017-10-24 12:56:05.000000000,2017-10-24 12:56:05.000000000,0,1,0,514226,4bd6334e90238959ee34fe33d861459a180415ae,17,3,1,1,6816,Jesse Pretorius,jesse-pretorius,Remove unified queue from gate pipeline
Initially the intent for adding this was to better test
any patches for roles together before they merge, but it
has had the unintended side-effect of causing patches to
take much longer to merge (because they all get lined up
in a single queue, rather than independent queues) and
a lot more infra resources are used (because a patch
that fails at the top of the queue will result in all
subsequent patches restarting all their tests).
As discussed in the channel, we'd prefer to revert back
to the previous independent queue method of testing. It
has served us well.
Change-Id: I2ed050f5f9bfe2f5a6fbbe83f421a0d5eaa3dedc

openstack%2Ftripleo-heat-templates~stable%2Focata~If76763b367917fc15f609ad144679750602826eb,openstack/tripleo-heat-templates,stable/ocata,bug/1716777-stable/ocata,If76763b367917fc15f609ad144679750602826eb,Support for Satellite Capsule in rhel-registration,MERGED,2017-10-19 03:31:10.000000000,2017-10-24 12:55:44.000000000,2017-10-24 12:55:44.000000000,15,9,0,513240,b8680d53b82aed219ec006451add8f112b199451,13,3,1,2,3153,Emilien Macchi,emilienm,Support for Satellite Capsule in rhel-registration
For deployments running on RHEL with Satellite 6 (or beyond) with
Capsule (Katello API enabled), the Katello API is available
on 8443 port, so the previous API ping didn't work for this case.
Capsule is now supported since we just check if katello-ca-consumer-latest
rpm is available to tell that Satellite version is 6 or beyond.
Closes-Bug: #1716777
(cherry picked from commit ad3ea5bb7a2ee2cb1ae6b1d21b2f0b5a177c9fc6)

openstack%2Fpython-tripleoclient~master~I9192492580ec95c7d5c9c2ab7b06b79a73025859,openstack/python-tripleoclient,master,bug/1723057,I9192492580ec95c7d5c9c2ab7b06b79a73025859,Add --environment-directory to the prepare command,MERGED,2017-10-12 16:26:27.000000000,2017-10-24 12:50:24.000000000,2017-10-24 12:50:24.000000000,44,17,0,511521,40fe7915653f0dbfd3f19ace4b4be52fcee3c96f,17,6,3,4,13039,Martin André,mandre,Add --environment-directory to the prepare command

to match what the deploy command does.

openstack%2Fpython-tripleoclient~master~I24a6021d19ffe74760f9897e9bf3453742939bc9,openstack/python-tripleoclient,master,bug/1723057,I24a6021d19ffe74760f9897e9bf3453742939bc9,Rename options to the prepare command for clarity,MERGED,2017-10-12 15:53:41.000000000,2017-10-24 12:50:24.000000000,2017-10-24 12:50:23.000000000,45,11,0,511514,d2cc4c548978b94ef7a78cd6479d191c38ee1736,27,7,3,3,13039,Martin André,mandre,Rename options to the prepare command for clarity
Changed the following options:
* '--images-file' to '--output-images-file'
* '--env-file' to '--output-env-file'
* '--service-environment-file' to '--environment-file' in order to
match the equivalent option of the deploy command.
The old options are still in place and show a Deprecation warning in
the help message.
Closes-Bug: #1723157

openstack%2Fnova~stable%2Fpike~I7b70cf8d5233bd25bf865a1b2789640758493c2b,openstack/nova,stable/pike,bug/1715182,I7b70cf8d5233bd25bf865a1b2789640758493c2b,Remove dest node allocations during live migration rollback,MERGED,2017-10-05 22:21:34.000000000,2017-10-24 12:49:51.000000000,2017-10-24 12:49:51.000000000,71,43,0,509926,76a3465271bdf48ebf579df77bb93739f39745c0,15,10,2,4,6873,Matt Riedemann,mriedem,Remove dest node allocations during live migration rollback
When a live migration fails or is cancelled, either during
pre_live_migration on the destination host or during the
actual live migration itself, we rollback from the failure/abort
by doing things like removing volume connections from the
destination host and re-setup the network on the source host.
As part of the rollback from a failed or cancelled live migration,
we also need to remove the allocations created in Placement for the
destination node, since the instance is not on the destination
node.
Change-Id: I7b70cf8d5233bd25bf865a1b2789640758493c2b
Closes-Bug: #1715182
Closes-Bug: #1714237

openstack%2Fopenstack-ansible-rabbitmq_server~master~I97d4ff7a61dc2c1fd9b8a8455f290d47161cf07a,openstack/openstack-ansible-rabbitmq_server,master,zuulv3-jobs,I97d4ff7a61dc2c1fd9b8a8455f290d47161cf07a,Remove unified queue from gate pipeline,MERGED,2017-10-23 10:32:03.000000000,2017-10-24 12:39:24.000000000,2017-10-24 12:39:24.000000000,0,1,0,514245,b68c27140654f5d34bdc0bae3cd0e5af3a4c36a7,16,3,1,1,6816,Jesse Pretorius,jesse-pretorius,Remove unified queue from gate pipeline
Initially the intent for adding this was to better test
any patches for roles together before they merge, but it
has had the unintended side-effect of causing patches to
take much longer to merge (because they all get lined up
in a single queue, rather than independent queues) and
a lot more infra resources are used (because a patch
that fails at the top of the queue will result in all
subsequent patches restarting all their tests).
As discussed in the channel, we'd prefer to revert back
to the previous independent queue method of testing. It
has served us well.
Change-Id: I97d4ff7a61dc2c1fd9b8a8455f290d47161cf07a

openstack%2Fnova~master~Ie38baea53e41ca7ba8875fd113cd777810f17db7,openstack/nova,master,bug/1724524,Ie38baea53e41ca7ba8875fd113cd777810f17db7,Add test so we remember why CUSTOM_ prefix added,MERGED,2017-10-18 10:58:28.000000000,2017-10-24 11:38:03.000000000,2017-10-24 11:38:03.000000000,11,0,2,513001,f73d6eb1dc928c811231e059f293901405bed1ee,34,15,5,1,782,John Garbutt,johngarbutt,Add test so we remember why CUSTOM_ prefix added
While it is tempting as an ironic operator to have CUSTOM_FOO in
placement, nova flavors and ironic resource class attributes,
allow that makes for a more complicated mapping between ironic
resource classes and the resource classes in the general case,
and could cause confusion when there is a typo of CUSTOM vs CUSTM
that could get mapped very differently into placement.
Adding this test so it is clear this is a deliberate choice, and
git blame will find this git commit message.
Related-Bug: #1724524
Change-Id: Ie38baea53e41ca7ba8875fd113cd777810f17db7

openstack%2Fironic-inspector~master~I737ba38c6130e7ba123368b6081c4923d1423d98,openstack/ironic-inspector,master,doc-osc-usage,I737ba38c6130e7ba123368b6081c4923d1423d98,refer to 'openstack baremetal' CLI in docs,MERGED,2017-10-23 21:29:28.000000000,2017-10-24 10:46:58.000000000,2017-10-24 10:46:58.000000000,6,4,0,514462,16148bf6c8b8e5373d4f4cf70f644e611830c630,8,4,1,2,6618,Ruby Loo,rloo,refer to 'openstack baremetal' CLI in docs

openstack%2Fironic-inspector~master~I422473e888e5e49abb3e598fc2cf2f330620bdcd,openstack/ironic-inspector,master,bug/1719627,I422473e888e5e49abb3e598fc2cf2f330620bdcd,Generate version_id upon add_node,MERGED,2017-09-26 14:27:42.000000000,2017-10-24 10:46:58.000000000,2017-10-24 10:46:58.000000000,12,1,0,507559,82000e48ecdaa5738f6a7e69d94386977e714493,10,5,1,2,18653,Milan Kováčik,dparalen,Generate version_id upon add_node
The version_id isn't set during add_node() call. This function is called
when introspection starts for both ""new"" and existing node_info records.
As a result, race conditions can appear in an HA inspector deployment (see
the refered bug).
This patch makes sure a version_id is generated during the add_node() call
so stale record updates can be detected through the version_id mismatch
between the inspector memory and the DB record.
Change-Id: I422473e888e5e49abb3e598fc2cf2f330620bdcd
Closes-Bug: #1719627

openstack%2Ftripleo-heat-templates~stable%2Fpike~Ic2793d0cfb7b20f4661cb1a45793cae67a4868b4,openstack/tripleo-heat-templates,stable/pike,bug/1723788,Ic2793d0cfb7b20f4661cb1a45793cae67a4868b4,Disable SwiftDispersion when using docker,MERGED,2017-10-19 03:34:54.000000000,2017-10-24 10:16:14.000000000,2017-10-24 10:16:14.000000000,2,0,0,513244,dd6b7fe5422c2110ba54ee46a3a9aa72db2b1dee,26,3,2,1,3153,Emilien Macchi,emilienm,Disable SwiftDispersion when using docker
We currently have the following in the registry:
OS::TripleO::Services::SwiftDispersion: puppet/services/swift-dispersion.yaml
Since this service is included by default in the Controller role
it will be installed on the host even on a containerized deployment.
Let's noop this in docker.yaml until a containerized version of it
gets merged.

openstack%2Fgovernance~master~I1cfa2216451d056c1bdedd67186131c5e0901ecb,openstack/governance,master,formal-vote,I1cfa2216451d056c1bdedd67186131c5e0901ecb,Add mention of releasenotes to the PTI,MERGED,2017-10-05 18:29:10.000000000,2017-10-24 10:07:47.000000000,2017-10-24 10:07:47.000000000,73,0,0,509868,df438a73701f6588435f123963e08591625feef3,15,11,1,4,2,Monty Taylor,mordred,Add mention of releasenotes to the PTI
We expect this of OpenStack projects now. Be explicit about it.
Use the same overall structure as is used for Sphinx. Because we expect
reno requirements to be a much more consistent set, make listing them
explicitly in the repo optional. A reno releasenotes job should be able
to know what it needs to install to generate reno docs without any
specific instructions from the repo itself.
Change-Id: I1cfa2216451d056c1bdedd67186131c5e0901ecb

openstack%2Fgovernance~master~Ief487e1d20ea20facf398367ca03a6385182fb38,openstack/governance,master,formal-vote,Ief487e1d20ea20facf398367ca03a6385182fb38,Update PTI around documentation jobs,MERGED,2017-09-30 15:18:18.000000000,2017-10-24 10:03:46.000000000,2017-10-24 10:03:46.000000000,88,22,16,508694,2c0cdd2738310285e8ab363463fd4f10d7fca9c1,26,13,3,4,2,Monty Taylor,mordred,Update PTI around documentation jobs
Update our PTI for docs to be more about show Sphinx should operate.
Remove the mention of tox -evenv -- python setup.py build_sphinx which
is super OpenStack specific and ALSO doens't make anything any easier.
Define the Sphinx config and setup and apply it to all of the languages.
Then add a mention of developer-convenience additions for each language.
This should allow us to do sphinx docs one way regardless of language
without adding tox requirements to non-python projects, and to have our
python projects behave in a way consistent with other parts of the
python ecosystem such as readthedocs.
Change-Id: Ief487e1d20ea20facf398367ca03a6385182fb38

openstack%2Ftripleo-heat-templates~stable%2Fpike~If76763b367917fc15f609ad144679750602826eb,openstack/tripleo-heat-templates,stable/pike,bug/1716777-stable/pike,If76763b367917fc15f609ad144679750602826eb,Support for Satellite Capsule in rhel-registration,MERGED,2017-10-19 03:31:01.000000000,2017-10-24 10:03:13.000000000,2017-10-24 10:03:13.000000000,15,9,0,513239,598c7b6916056dbcfd09f0bf140ce8e492c88fa8,14,3,1,2,3153,Emilien Macchi,emilienm,Support for Satellite Capsule in rhel-registration
For deployments running on RHEL with Satellite 6 (or beyond) with
Capsule (Katello API enabled), the Katello API is available
on 8443 port, so the previous API ping didn't work for this case.
Capsule is now supported since we just check if katello-ca-consumer-latest

(cherry picked from commit ad3ea5bb7a2ee2cb1ae6b1d21b2f0b5a177c9fc6)

openstack%2Fopenstack-ansible-os_heat~master~I0472320f5d86a54b9ac97cb18f9288f4d58bda1c,openstack/openstack-ansible-os_heat,master,zuulv3-jobs,I0472320f5d86a54b9ac97cb18f9288f4d58bda1c,Remove unified queue from gate pipeline,MERGED,2017-10-23 10:19:44.000000000,2017-10-24 09:26:31.000000000,2017-10-24 09:26:31.000000000,0,1,0,514225,82ddbf569798b9c641f3b3eb942c9e6894261808,12,3,1,1,6816,Jesse Pretorius,jesse-pretorius,Remove unified queue from gate pipeline
Initially the intent for adding this was to better test
any patches for roles together before they merge, but it
has had the unintended side-effect of causing patches to
take much longer to merge (because they all get lined up
in a single queue, rather than independent queues) and
a lot more infra resources are used (because a patch
that fails at the top of the queue will result in all
subsequent patches restarting all their tests).
As discussed in the channel, we'd prefer to revert back
to the previous independent queue method of testing. It
has served us well.
Change-Id: I0472320f5d86a54b9ac97cb18f9288f4d58bda1c

openstack%2Fneutron~stable%2Fnewton~I629eeff905bf02ec5f7ee68cccc7c19f1b47d5aa,openstack/neutron,stable/newton,bug/1723848,I629eeff905bf02ec5f7ee68cccc7c19f1b47d5aa,Notify port_update to agent for status change,ABANDONED,2017-10-23 06:26:27.000000000,2017-10-24 09:08:30.000000000,,12,0,0,514140,ae8e4243e8c8c0317acf81730911c3d91d1ba985,12,8,2,2,10267,venkata anil,anil,Notify port_update to agent for status change
Notify agents about port update when ""port_update"" is called to update
port's status change. L3 agent will spawn keepalived only when HA
network port status is ACTIVE. When L3 agent is restarted, it sets HA
network port status to DOWN (through ""port_update""), with the assumption
that L2 agent will again rewire the port (set status to ACTIVE) allowing
L3 agent to spawn keepalived. As server is not notifying L2 agent, port
is remaining in DOWN status and L3 agent was never spawning keepalived
on L3 agent restart(if keepalived is killed).
Closes-Bug: 1723848
Change-Id: I629eeff905bf02ec5f7ee68cccc7c19f1b47d5aa
(cherry picked from commit 4f9a6a8b7661c3792101580d14d401e8426bf72a)

1. Instead of 'realm_name' and 'password' the module gets
'project_name' and 'api_key' respectively.

required during authentication.
Closes-bug: #1719560
Change-Id: I886480b9aaec8493039ff83e114b8183a0f5fddc

openstack%2Fopenstack-ansible-os_tempest~master~I8d0afd08f6c80594d69b8d711261ae6365fad917,openstack/openstack-ansible-os_tempest,master,513200,I8d0afd08f6c80594d69b8d711261ae6365fad917,Use the deployment host to download images for tempest,MERGED,2017-10-18 22:36:01.000000000,2017-10-24 09:00:04.000000000,2017-10-24 00:42:22.000000000,98,54,2,513200,5c307f9b20df6959a8953951f3da0f474e3288c3,30,5,6,5,6816,Jesse Pretorius,jesse-pretorius,Use the deployment host to download images for tempest
Currently there are two sets of image downloads happening,
which is a common cause of failure in jobs due to the fact
that they're downloaded from a URL outside of OpenStack-CI.
This patch consolidates them into a single single download,
but also uses the deploy host to do the download. The download
gets done to the same location as where the image is cached
in OpenStack-CI, so as long as the SHA256SUM matches, it
will skip the download - making our tests faster and more
reliable.
As part of this, some legacy and unnecessary variables have
been removed. Also, we were uploading the same image twice
into Glance which is unnecessary. Instead we re-use the same
image ID twice in the tempest configuration.
Change-Id: I8d0afd08f6c80594d69b8d711261ae6365fad917

openstack%2Fironic-python-agent~master~If4720ebed00f15c2a19cb8badbe4dc3c808eeece,openstack/ironic-python-agent,master,,If4720ebed00f15c2a19cb8badbe4dc3c808eeece,Improve the catching of calls to 'execute' related functions,MERGED,2017-05-18 20:35:34.000000000,2017-10-24 08:47:59.000000000,2017-10-24 08:47:59.000000000,30,13,7,466100,ef838dd6bbb8d3c830a69ff2bf6a21b90b9adfaf,15,5,4,2,14760,John L. Villalovos,jlvillal,Improve the catching of calls to 'execute' related functions
Improve the catching of calls to 'execute' related functions in unit
tests. Before we only caught calls to utils.execute(). Now we catch
calls to:
ironic_lib.utils.execute()
processutils.execute()
subprocess.call()
subprocess.check_call()
subprocess.check_output()
utils.execute()
Change-Id: If4720ebed00f15c2a19cb8badbe4dc3c808eeece

openstack%2Fmonasca-notification~master~Ia75c3b60d0fada854178f21ca5ccb9e6a880f37f,openstack/monasca-notification,master,review/tomasz_tr_bski/story/2000959,Ia75c3b60d0fada854178f21ca5ccb9e6a880f37f,Integrate with oslo.conf and oslo.log,MERGED,2017-05-15 22:21:07.000000000,2017-10-24 08:04:04.000000000,2017-10-24 08:04:04.000000000,2004,605,61,464768,e1a9b9a96a56ec5476a21556e5ace61996afd74c,90,14,33,53,16168,Tomasz Trębski,trebskit,Integrate with oslo.conf and oslo.log
Change upgrades the monasca-notification to leverage
the capabilities of both oslo.log and oslo.conf:
- configuration of logging separated from application settings
- ability to enforce data types for application settings
- ability to use oslo.config-generator capabilities
- automatic configuration parsing done by oslo.cfg
That change will bring it closer to the rest of monasca
components where such transition has happened already.
However, in the rest of monasca, oslo.cfg was partially
or fully implemented whereas monasca-notification has
been relying on YAML based configuration file.
Therefore backward compatybility for such format will
be kept for now.
Task: 4093
Task: 4092
Change-Id: Ia75c3b60d0fada854178f21ca5ccb9e6a880f37f

openstack%2Fpuppet-tripleo~stable%2Fpike~I0dd06e953b4c81f217d0f4199b2337e4c3358086,openstack/puppet-tripleo,stable/pike,host-attributes-stable/pike,I0dd06e953b4c81f217d0f4199b2337e4c3358086,Set meta container-attribute-target=host attribute,MERGED,2017-10-05 16:25:48.000000000,2017-10-24 07:50:41.000000000,2017-10-24 07:50:40.000000000,8,7,0,509824,250d979aea7055eaed0c1dfa5850514c816da195,13,5,1,4,6449,Chris Jones,cmsj,Set meta container-attribute-target=host attribute
This is needed because when we run bundles we actually
want to store attributes on a per-node basis and not on a per-bundle
basis. By activating this attribute pacemaker will pass
some extra OCS_RESKEY_CRM_meta attributes that will help us in this
decision.
We can merge this once we have packages for pacemaker and
resource-agents releases that contain the necessary fixes.
Proper pacemaker and resource-agents are now in the repo [1] so
we can merge it and backport it to pike.
[1] https://buildlogs.centos.org/centos/7/cloud/x86_64/openstack-pike/
Closes-Bug: #1713007
(cherry picked from commit 6bcb011723ad7b75f18914c887dc4fa4bad4d620)

openstack%2Fnova~master~I20992acef119f11f6584094438043a760fc4a287,openstack/nova,master,bug/1717892,I20992acef119f11f6584094438043a760fc4a287,hyperv: report disk_available_least field,MERGED,2017-09-18 10:19:34.000000000,2017-10-24 06:19:45.000000000,2017-10-24 06:19:44.000000000,7,0,0,504904,21bb17499f83ec67aaadd8affb6d2899e567d151,30,15,2,2,8213,Claudiu Belu,claudiub,hyperv: report disk_available_least field
Reporting the disk_available_least field can help in making sure
the scheduler doesn't pick a host that cannot fit a specific flavor's
disk.
The reported local_gb_used is calculated based on the instances spawned
by nova on a certain compute node, and might not reflect the actual
reality, especially on shared storage scenarios.
Closes-Bug: #1717892

openstack%2Fneutron~stable%2Focata~I629eeff905bf02ec5f7ee68cccc7c19f1b47d5aa,openstack/neutron,stable/ocata,bug/1723848-stable/pike-stable/ocata,I629eeff905bf02ec5f7ee68cccc7c19f1b47d5aa,Notify port_update to agent for status change,MERGED,2017-10-23 06:26:15.000000000,2017-10-24 06:19:41.000000000,2017-10-24 06:19:41.000000000,12,0,0,514139,d6645ad1713b091181dd1765e0e11e7ccb25f568,12,8,1,2,10267,venkata anil,anil,Notify port_update to agent for status change
Notify agents about port update when ""port_update"" is called to update
port's status change. L3 agent will spawn keepalived only when HA
network port status is ACTIVE. When L3 agent is restarted, it sets HA
network port status to DOWN (through ""port_update""), with the assumption
that L2 agent will again rewire the port (set status to ACTIVE) allowing
L3 agent to spawn keepalived. As server is not notifying L2 agent, port
is remaining in DOWN status and L3 agent was never spawning keepalived
on L3 agent restart(if keepalived is killed).
Closes-Bug: 1723848
Change-Id: I629eeff905bf02ec5f7ee68cccc7c19f1b47d5aa
(cherry picked from commit 4f9a6a8b7661c3792101580d14d401e8426bf72a)

openstack%2Fpaunch~master~I72b4a131591d50528f99a24fefaf458434390ba7,openstack/paunch,master,uts,I72b4a131591d50528f99a24fefaf458434390ba7,Add option to configure uts namespace,MERGED,2017-10-11 13:14:58.000000000,2017-10-24 05:52:33.000000000,2017-10-24 05:52:33.000000000,11,1,0,511234,e852f80e1ffbceaaf4ae59e061e13f8dcb2321ef,34,9,1,4,10873,Juan Antonio Osorio Robles,ejuaoso,Add option to configure uts namespace

openstack%2Fopenstack-ansible-os_designate~master~I1678b9eac38dc74f820d4779149317c4dacc31cf,openstack/openstack-ansible-os_designate,master,zuulv3-jobs,I1678b9eac38dc74f820d4779149317c4dacc31cf,Remove unified queue from gate pipeline,MERGED,2017-10-23 10:17:49.000000000,2017-10-24 05:49:08.000000000,2017-10-24 05:49:08.000000000,0,1,0,514222,a508c2986e479a1969f711339f2eb0d2e6f030e7,11,3,1,1,6816,Jesse Pretorius,jesse-pretorius,Remove unified queue from gate pipeline
Initially the intent for adding this was to better test
any patches for roles together before they merge, but it
has had the unintended side-effect of causing patches to
take much longer to merge (because they all get lined up
in a single queue, rather than independent queues) and
a lot more infra resources are used (because a patch
that fails at the top of the queue will result in all
subsequent patches restarting all their tests).
As discussed in the channel, we'd prefer to revert back
to the previous independent queue method of testing. It
has served us well.
Change-Id: I1678b9eac38dc74f820d4779149317c4dacc31cf

openstack%2Fnova~master~I6b7e41cac7fd597416f1dc9825ccdd51a821af99,openstack/nova,master,avoid_translation,I6b7e41cac7fd597416f1dc9825ccdd51a821af99,Avoid forcing translation on logging calls,ABANDONED,2016-12-22 03:10:15.000000000,2017-10-24 04:47:15.000000000,,17,19,24,413876,131011cbc7cc2f881a8c1deac66721de6081888c,678,29,44,8,7634,Takashi Natsume,natsumet,Avoid forcing translation on logging calls
Remove six.text_type() on logging calls.
According to the oslo.i18n guideline(*1),
forcing the translation of translatable variables should be avoided.
*1: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#avoid-forcing-the-translation-of-translatable-variables
The unit test in the following file has been changed to check
whether an exception is passed directly as an argument of
the log method or not.
- nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py
TrivialFix
Change-Id: I6b7e41cac7fd597416f1dc9825ccdd51a821af99

openstack%2Fzun~master~Ib47e76d14b3dc036f903a3988bb138288cdb601e,openstack/zun,master,bp/direct-cinder-integration,Ib47e76d14b3dc036f903a3988bb138288cdb601e,Implement Cinder attach workflow,MERGED,2017-08-30 22:23:33.000000000,2017-10-24 04:21:04.000000000,2017-10-24 04:21:03.000000000,995,0,12,499374,18b3b059c4d058f874b4fa1ff1f3284c447129ab,66,6,27,14,11536,hongbin,hongbin,Implement Cinder attach workflow
The attach workflow is as following:
* reserve_volume in Cinder
* initialize_connection in Cinder
* connect_volume in os_brick
* attach in Cinder
If the workflow executes sucessfully, the Cinder volume
is attached to the compute host as a device. Zun will
mount the device to the filesystem in order to use it.
The detach workflow is as following:
* begin_detach in Cinder
* disconnect_volume in os_brick
* terminate_connection in Cinder
* detach in Cinder
Partial-Implements: blueprint direct-cinder-integration
Change-Id: Ib47e76d14b3dc036f903a3988bb138288cdb601e

openstack%2Fceilometer~stable%2Focata~If546d2ba3096733d6bab44ad4585d8e7c556437e,openstack/ceilometer,stable/ocata,bug/1706420-stable/ocata,If546d2ba3096733d6bab44ad4585d8e7c556437e,fix cpu_util precision is too precise,MERGED,2017-10-11 03:30:51.000000000,2017-10-24 04:05:38.000000000,2017-10-24 04:05:38.000000000,3,3,0,511097,f8fc2172af6aab963c85fb483eb03f086cc0e892,14,7,1,1,22752,Hanxi Liu,Hanxi_Liu,fix cpu_util precision is too precise

openstack%2Fopenstack-ansible-apt_package_pinning~master~I224c1e083bddb69ce612e89ead3544cfdfa21cbc,openstack/openstack-ansible-apt_package_pinning,master,zuulv3-jobs,I224c1e083bddb69ce612e89ead3544cfdfa21cbc,Remove unified queue from gate pipeline,MERGED,2017-10-23 10:08:42.000000000,2017-10-24 04:03:36.000000000,2017-10-24 04:03:35.000000000,0,1,0,514206,2cbbf782cc0b6bef7b1f8fb4705d1cda287b8fc0,8,3,1,1,6816,Jesse Pretorius,jesse-pretorius,Remove unified queue from gate pipeline
Initially the intent for adding this was to better test
any patches for roles together before they merge, but it
has had the unintended side-effect of causing patches to
take much longer to merge (because they all get lined up
in a single queue, rather than independent queues) and
a lot more infra resources are used (because a patch
that fails at the top of the queue will result in all
subsequent patches restarting all their tests).
As discussed in the channel, we'd prefer to revert back
to the previous independent queue method of testing. It
has served us well.
Change-Id: I224c1e083bddb69ce612e89ead3544cfdfa21cbc

openstack%2Fneutron~master~I09e1e5dbecd64bc798b9b147b99d35d3f13b361a,openstack/neutron,master,bug/1653025,I09e1e5dbecd64bc798b9b147b99d35d3f13b361a,Don't ensure default security group when listing sg,ABANDONED,2017-05-12 13:22:29.000000000,2017-10-24 03:56:17.000000000,,6,15,1,464194,880b54f2fb96d09d2c0d45763b57df31ace72f57,28,10,3,3,21781,Hunt Xu,huntxu,Don't ensure default security group when listing sg
The default_sg parameter for get_security_groups has no longer any user.
It was introduced to ensure there is a default security group within a
tenant before the creation of any ports in that tenant. However this is
now done by registry callbacks.
The current logic leads to the known side effect that listing security
groups in an invalid tenant will create a default security group in it
because neutron doesn't do any tenant/project validation.
This commit eliminates the mentioned side effect by remove the default
security group ensuring logic in security group listing.
Closes-Bug: #1653025
Change-Id: I09e1e5dbecd64bc798b9b147b99d35d3f13b361a
Signed-off-by: Hunt Xu <mhuntxu@gmail.com>

openstack%2Ftripleo-heat-templates~stable%2Fpike~I1c1267f19db972b55466f4649eda62dd7814b94a,openstack/tripleo-heat-templates,stable/pike,bug/1723177,I1c1267f19db972b55466f4649eda62dd7814b94a,Remove deprecation handling from custom roles,MERGED,2017-10-16 23:11:00.000000000,2017-10-24 03:55:39.000000000,2017-10-24 03:55:39.000000000,0,22,1,512445,09dbd6733cba19939a51fe61e94a1162ee7883e7,28,4,3,1,3153,Emilien Macchi,emilienm,Remove deprecation handling from custom roles
For deployed-server custom roles, the deprecation handlings are removed.
As these have always been custom roles with definitions generated from
role.role.j2.yaml, these original (now deprecated) param names were
never present for anyone using this deployed-server roles data file.
Specifically, deprecated_server_resource_name is quite troublesome as it
will cause the server resources to get replaced on upgrade as the
resource name changes.
These were all introduced in If4a8388634fb1dcbb47beeabbd3db005abc80d4e,
and this commit removes them.
Change-Id: I1c1267f19db972b55466f4649eda62dd7814b94a
Closes-Bug: #1723177
(cherry picked from commit 6e7a431df0b7790512eb1920500b8878701c691a)

openstack%2Fproject-config~master~Id10e37e5a2a32b7051c986f0541b1ed9f326e95c,openstack/project-config,master,zuulv3-jobs,Id10e37e5a2a32b7051c986f0541b1ed9f326e95c,Use bash for the release/tag playbook,MERGED,2017-10-23 23:42:34.000000000,2017-10-24 00:03:15.000000000,2017-10-24 00:03:15.000000000,2,0,0,514491,39ddeb514472ce4c836a37bc127f97980ccee986,7,3,1,1,5263,Jeremy Stanley,fungi,Use bash for the release/tag playbook
The tag playbook used for the tag-releases job attempts to export a
variable containing a path relative to the user's homedir. This
works fine for tilde expansion in bash, but in vanilla sh ends up
passing a literal tilde into the consuming scripts at least some of
which do not perform their own os.path.expanduser() on the string.
Go ahead and explicitly use bash for the shell task in this playbook
to get the advance expansion it seems to assume.
Change-Id: Id10e37e5a2a32b7051c986f0541b1ed9f326e95c

openstack%2Ftripleo-common~master~I8b67323f250fcfcf37a15dcc29024e5ce1506bb4,openstack/tripleo-common,master,task-names-are-not-always-needed-btw,I8b67323f250fcfcf37a15dcc29024e5ce1506bb4,Remove references to the current task from task() in stack.yaml,MERGED,2017-10-20 09:22:35.000000000,2017-10-24 00:02:26.000000000,2017-10-24 00:02:26.000000000,2,2,0,513677,86f341a347a05e21a6daccff810ed501db0c9093,15,8,3,1,9712,Dougal Matthews,dougal,Remove references to the current task from task() in stack.yaml
When using the task() expression function within a mistral task the name
is only needed when referncing a different task. These were found with
the mistral-lint PyPI package.
Change-Id: I8b67323f250fcfcf37a15dcc29024e5ce1506bb4

openstack%2Fironic~stable%2Fpike~Ib728fadbdab2eb9f1ba5112297a32dbdbfd1d5fd,openstack/ironic,stable/pike,513696-patch2,Ib728fadbdab2eb9f1ba5112297a32dbdbfd1d5fd,Move ironic legacy jobs into the ironic tree,MERGED,2017-10-20 10:00:48.000000000,2017-10-23 23:44:11.000000000,2017-10-23 23:44:11.000000000,2674,0,2,513696,f2ce509e082a0b68e6662f4325282b181827fa41,29,10,8,31,12356,Vladyslav Drok,vdrok,Move ironic legacy jobs into the ironic tree
This patch moves the legacy ironic CI jobs into the ironic tree instead
of storing them in openstack-infra/openstack-zuul-jobs to give us
control as we migrate the legacy jobs to the new ansible roles.
This also removes branch specifics from project.yaml, leaving only the
jobs we need to run on current release.
Change-Id: Ib728fadbdab2eb9f1ba5112297a32dbdbfd1d5fd
(cherry picked from commit 4b37c29b5e180d68e744e8114e2f414023d1376a)

openstack%2Fopenstack-zuul-jobs~master~I43373c12766c95573367262b9e24beb8ef6b8098,openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs,master,base-test,I43373c12766c95573367262b9e24beb8ef6b8098,[dnm] parent integration test to base-test,ABANDONED,2017-10-16 01:21:02.000000000,2017-10-23 22:23:51.000000000,,1,16,0,512135,6b95e09244ec14e4c53ee0eb3b9f159d82bc8c05,11,2,2,1,7118,Ian Wienand,iwienand,[dnm] parent integration test to base-test

openstack%2Fproject-config~master~I65b2583a50effc7d743f2bb9231b35ec7659e4fa,openstack/project-config,master,nodepool-migration,I65b2583a50effc7d743f2bb9231b35ec7659e4fa,Remove py27-based template for nodepool,MERGED,2017-10-20 15:26:59.000000000,2017-10-23 22:12:10.000000000,2017-10-23 22:12:10.000000000,0,1,0,513770,4998a9cd2b51027ec4eae11349887a95855b4bf2,8,3,1,1,3099,David Shrewsbury,dshrews,Remove py27-based template for nodepool
We don't want the tox-py27 job running on the feature/zuulv3
branch (we ended support for that a while back). The only way
to not make it run is to remove the openstack-python-jobs-no-constraints
template from the project definition and run that template's jobs
directly from the in-repo project definition. That change can be
seen in the referenced Needed-By change below.
Change-Id: I65b2583a50effc7d743f2bb9231b35ec7659e4fa

openstack%2Fnetworking-odl~master~I76d329ccfb433f56446c207041b5d087e52a74c0,openstack/networking-odl,master,506996,I76d329ccfb433f56446c207041b5d087e52a74c0,Added ODL installation flag,MERGED,2017-09-25 06:08:17.000000000,2017-10-23 20:42:58.000000000,2017-10-23 20:42:58.000000000,17,0,10,506996,60071263b229a7800a7625942de914b966526b3e,19,5,3,3,13912,rajiv,rajiv.kumar,Added ODL installation flag

openstack%2Fopenstack-ansible-rsyslog_client~master~I95685a5a42c9f191610ae5ef1436398d093d69bc,openstack/openstack-ansible-rsyslog_client,master,zuulv3-jobs,I95685a5a42c9f191610ae5ef1436398d093d69bc,Remove unified queue from gate pipeline,MERGED,2017-10-23 10:33:58.000000000,2017-10-23 20:34:09.000000000,2017-10-23 20:34:09.000000000,0,1,0,514248,fbe80ae3665a1d815e133244e294ad06020e0a3d,7,3,1,1,6816,Jesse Pretorius,jesse-pretorius,Remove unified queue from gate pipeline
Initially the intent for adding this was to better test
any patches for roles together before they merge, but it
has had the unintended side-effect of causing patches to
take much longer to merge (because they all get lined up
in a single queue, rather than independent queues) and
a lot more infra resources are used (because a patch
that fails at the top of the queue will result in all
subsequent patches restarting all their tests).
As discussed in the channel, we'd prefer to revert back
to the previous independent queue method of testing. It
has served us well.
Change-Id: I95685a5a42c9f191610ae5ef1436398d093d69bc

openstack%2Fmistral~stable%2Fpike~I816c8c2a940e38cf1698d76e1019671249238598,openstack/mistral,stable/pike,fix_scheduler_deletion-stable/pike,I816c8c2a940e38cf1698d76e1019671249238598,Fix deletion of delayed calls,MERGED,2017-10-23 14:38:19.000000000,2017-10-23 19:17:33.000000000,2017-10-23 19:17:33.000000000,22,0,0,514337,b5f45ba5de0e95081fba17a2aa894039fa28eb3d,6,2,1,5,8731,Renat Akhmerov,rakhmerov,Fix deletion of delayed calls
* Deletion of delayed calls is incorrect. A list of delayed calls
gets deleted within one DB transaction and if at least one object
is not deleted because of a DBDeadlock exception (on MySQL) then
the entire transaction fails and, what's more important, the
exception is swallowed by the try-finally block without reraising
it so that it could be handled by the ""retry_on_deadlock"" decorator.
This patch fixes this problem by reraising the initial exception.
* Added ""retry_on_deadlock"" decorator to all methods methods that
open DB transactions and where we have a risk of hitting a deadlock.
(cherry picked from commit 397a56278809fe1be62c55040042f310ca97b5e0)

openstack%2Fopenstack-ansible-plugins~master~Ib4174ca5639b68871b1227ba41611872d6ba6a90,openstack/openstack-ansible-plugins,master,zuulv3-jobs,Ib4174ca5639b68871b1227ba41611872d6ba6a90,Remove unified queue from gate pipeline,MERGED,2017-10-23 10:31:24.000000000,2017-10-23 19:14:16.000000000,2017-10-23 19:14:16.000000000,0,1,0,514244,6a64c8e7dbc1d3a6cbb444dbcdefbeb4632c01fa,7,3,1,1,6816,Jesse Pretorius,jesse-pretorius,Remove unified queue from gate pipeline
Initially the intent for adding this was to better test
any patches for roles together before they merge, but it
has had the unintended side-effect of causing patches to
take much longer to merge (because they all get lined up
in a single queue, rather than independent queues) and
a lot more infra resources are used (because a patch
that fails at the top of the queue will result in all
subsequent patches restarting all their tests).
As discussed in the channel, we'd prefer to revert back
to the previous independent queue method of testing. It
has served us well.

openstack%2Fopenstack-ansible-os_zaqar~master~Ia8a54b619cf28fd924264206caff926ee9ed2ca8,openstack/openstack-ansible-os_zaqar,master,zuulv3-jobs,Ia8a54b619cf28fd924264206caff926ee9ed2ca8,Remove unified queue from gate pipeline,MERGED,2017-10-23 10:30:06.000000000,2017-10-23 19:14:15.000000000,2017-10-23 19:14:15.000000000,0,1,0,514242,0139b6270b2eac9173d433f9790839ff1b1caf70,7,3,1,1,6816,Jesse Pretorius,jesse-pretorius,Remove unified queue from gate pipeline
Initially the intent for adding this was to better test
any patches for roles together before they merge, but it
has had the unintended side-effect of causing patches to
take much longer to merge (because they all get lined up
in a single queue, rather than independent queues) and
a lot more infra resources are used (because a patch
that fails at the top of the queue will result in all
subsequent patches restarting all their tests).
As discussed in the channel, we'd prefer to revert back
to the previous independent queue method of testing. It
has served us well.
Change-Id: Ia8a54b619cf28fd924264206caff926ee9ed2ca8

openstack%2Fproject-config~master~I0aa4b4548989ae319d8644f096b07a84e8eba141,openstack/project-config,master,zuulv3-jobs,I0aa4b4548989ae319d8644f096b07a84e8eba141,Run wheel builds only once,MERGED,2017-10-23 06:19:12.000000000,2017-10-23 18:25:27.000000000,2017-10-23 18:25:27.000000000,3,0,0,514135,8712b4edaf4e02900cced4cae718a7d03909cf01,7,3,1,1,6547,Andreas Jaeger,jaegerandi,Run wheel builds only once

openstack%2Fopenstack-helm~master~I9ec1dbb00d997ab6cb021bf0b698f7aae740e95d,openstack/openstack-helm,master,image/tags,I9ec1dbb00d997ab6cb021bf0b698f7aae740e95d,Images: Update values to allow simple parse of images being used,MERGED,2017-10-23 14:02:57.000000000,2017-10-23 18:21:11.000000000,2017-10-23 17:49:28.000000000,427,400,0,514325,fe6107cf7692c03b014d063b7bd3bd5241aa3b9f,14,4,2,204,23928,Pete Birley,portdirect,Images: Update values to allow simple parse of images being used
This PS updates the values file layout for images to allow simple
parsing of the images in use by charts, allowing them to be queried
and modified much more simply. By moving the image tags to a 'tags'
key, we can extend the options used simply to accomodate extra
options simply (eg prefixing the tag for use with an internal
registry) or pre-pulling the images to reduce chart deploy failure.
Change-Id: I9ec1dbb00d997ab6cb021bf0b698f7aae740e95d

openstack%2Fsahara~master~I35f068b56a8c6982ca90f3a93ae1076339da9959,openstack/sahara,master,trivalfix,I35f068b56a8c6982ca90f3a93ae1076339da9959,Fix typo in advanced-configuration-guide.rst and manager.py,MERGED,2017-10-11 16:13:19.000000000,2017-10-23 18:15:20.000000000,2017-10-23 18:15:20.000000000,2,2,2,511284,96cb88759f907809b93e3aec2007eb9e9b80079a,15,8,1,2,26251,sun cheng,hellosuncshine,Fix typo in advanced-configuration-guide.rst and manager.py

openstack%2Fironic-python-agent~stable%2Fpike~I10ca70d6a390ed802505c0d10d440dfb52beb56c,openstack/ironic-python-agent,stable/pike,bug/1670916-stable/pike,I10ca70d6a390ed802505c0d10d440dfb52beb56c,Fix waiting for target disk to appear,MERGED,2017-10-17 14:25:05.000000000,2017-10-23 18:13:20.000000000,2017-10-23 18:13:20.000000000,158,102,0,512643,bd8c6c7420c5a913ff407da569c1b8dfbc0a488a,7,4,1,8,10239,Dmitry Tantsur,dtantsur,Fix waiting for target disk to appear
This patch is changing the _wait_for_disks() method behavior to wait to
a specific disk if any device hints is specified. There are cases where
the deployment might fail or succeed randomly depending on the order and
time that the disks shows up.
If no root device hints is specified, the method will just wait for any
suitable disk to show up, like before.
The _wait_for_disks call was made into a proper hardware manager method.
It is now also called each time the cached node is updated, not only
on start up. This is to ensure that we wait for the device, matching
root device hints (which are part of the node).
The loop was corrected to avoid redundant sleeps and warnings.
Finally, this patch adds more logging around detecting the root device.
Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Tantsur <dtantsur@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I10ca70d6a390ed802505c0d10d440dfb52beb56c
Closes-Bug: #1670916
(cherry picked from commit 3189c16a5e95ade468fa8bc37302eb9979f5a8c9)

openstack%2Fsahara~master~I8f228ca40acc589b9aa41fc1e80a1c0308f179cf,openstack/sahara,master,policy-and-docs-in-code,I8f228ca40acc589b9aa41fc1e80a1c0308f179cf,Policy in code for Sahara,MERGED,2017-09-12 21:38:40.000000000,2017-10-23 18:12:28.000000000,2017-10-23 18:12:28.000000000,887,80,48,503221,5d208ed486ee8cc4cb80e98de706014c0645e033,83,10,22,20,8932,Telles Mota Vidal Nóbrega,tellesnobrega,Policy in code for Sahara

openstack%2Fopenstack-ansible-os_searchlight~master~I8658108ad13cdc2fb2ff27e3079577f638cdbb11,openstack/openstack-ansible-os_searchlight,master,zuulv3-jobs,I8658108ad13cdc2fb2ff27e3079577f638cdbb11,Remove unified queue from gate pipeline,MERGED,2017-10-23 10:26:16.000000000,2017-10-23 18:03:41.000000000,2017-10-23 18:03:41.000000000,0,1,0,514236,0799f49f009716b2e010a019d9157c4236e66182,7,3,1,1,6816,Jesse Pretorius,jesse-pretorius,Remove unified queue from gate pipeline
Initially the intent for adding this was to better test
any patches for roles together before they merge, but it
has had the unintended side-effect of causing patches to
take much longer to merge (because they all get lined up
in a single queue, rather than independent queues) and
a lot more infra resources are used (because a patch
that fails at the top of the queue will result in all
subsequent patches restarting all their tests).
As discussed in the channel, we'd prefer to revert back
to the previous independent queue method of testing. It
has served us well.
Change-Id: I8658108ad13cdc2fb2ff27e3079577f638cdbb11

openstack%2Fopenstack-ansible-os_ironic~master~If41d708ec98712de6a2a5a36db8d0e8d34efcd53,openstack/openstack-ansible-os_ironic,master,zuulv3-jobs,If41d708ec98712de6a2a5a36db8d0e8d34efcd53,Remove unified queue from gate pipeline,MERGED,2017-10-23 10:21:01.000000000,2017-10-23 17:50:08.000000000,2017-10-23 17:50:08.000000000,0,1,0,514227,ded7f989e0bc515506301929d4ff1a867aa3e73a,7,3,1,1,6816,Jesse Pretorius,jesse-pretorius,Remove unified queue from gate pipeline
Initially the intent for adding this was to better test
any patches for roles together before they merge, but it
has had the unintended side-effect of causing patches to
take much longer to merge (because they all get lined up
in a single queue, rather than independent queues) and
a lot more infra resources are used (because a patch
that fails at the top of the queue will result in all
subsequent patches restarting all their tests).
As discussed in the channel, we'd prefer to revert back
to the previous independent queue method of testing. It
has served us well.
Change-Id: If41d708ec98712de6a2a5a36db8d0e8d34efcd53

openstack%2Fnetworking-odl~master~Ie4a75323694c69aaa5e682890647beaf461b6888,openstack/networking-odl,master,bug/1724644,Ie4a75323694c69aaa5e682890647beaf461b6888,Fixes URL path for SFC v2 Driver,MERGED,2017-10-18 18:23:30.000000000,2017-10-23 17:47:38.000000000,2017-10-23 16:31:50.000000000,17,1,0,513158,7366ac0455a335e8f56a8467515bca33f3d29e28,15,7,3,3,17280,Tim Rozet,trozet,Fixes URL path for SFC v2 Driver
Due to this fix https://review.openstack.org/#/c/496388/,
now URL for OpenDaylight driver is not created correctly.
Correct url has format
http://<hostname>/controller/nb/v2/neutron/sfc/portpairs
Now it produces
http://<hostname>/controller/nb/v2/neutron/sfc/port-pairs
Closes-Bug: 1724644
Partial-bug: #1713697
Duplicate-patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/512951/
Change-Id: Ie4a75323694c69aaa5e682890647beaf461b6888
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Rajiv Kumar <rajiv.kumar@nectechnologies.in>

openstack%2Fheat~master~I6bde1f9359cd52c99cca092e8abc660bac8b3065,openstack/heat,master,bug/1722371,I6bde1f9359cd52c99cca092e8abc660bac8b3065,Don't attempt to update tmpl ID when resource in progress,MERGED,2017-10-09 19:53:35.000000000,2017-10-23 16:27:50.000000000,2017-10-23 15:10:44.000000000,2,0,0,510674,79cc0cc7b93b98ebb1e7e0d7f838fc1186d7bc47,18,5,3,1,4257,Zane Bitter,zaneb,Don't attempt to update tmpl ID when resource in progress
If we attempt to do a convergence update on a resource and find it already
locked by another traversal, don't try to update the resource's current
template ID or requirements data. Doing so will usually fail with the same
exception, but it is unnecessary and leaves ERROR-level messages in the
log. However, there is a race which could result in the call succeeding
(i.e. if the other task releases the lock just after we fail to get it),
and that could result in the resource not being updated at all.
Change-Id: I6bde1f9359cd52c99cca092e8abc660bac8b3065
Closes-Bug: #1722371

openstack%2Fopenstack-ansible-os_cloudkitty~master~I62152f7407a4f6737a8bdba0f1af557f8302746c,openstack/openstack-ansible-os_cloudkitty,master,zuulv3-jobs,I62152f7407a4f6737a8bdba0f1af557f8302746c,Remove unified queue from gate pipeline,MERGED,2017-10-23 10:17:12.000000000,2017-10-23 16:26:38.000000000,2017-10-23 16:26:38.000000000,0,1,0,514221,004db0f1400baa11452deb3ddac1c6bcad0ce816,7,3,1,1,6816,Jesse Pretorius,jesse-pretorius,Remove unified queue from gate pipeline
Initially the intent for adding this was to better test
any patches for roles together before they merge, but it
has had the unintended side-effect of causing patches to
take much longer to merge (because they all get lined up
in a single queue, rather than independent queues) and
a lot more infra resources are used (because a patch
that fails at the top of the queue will result in all
subsequent patches restarting all their tests).
As discussed in the channel, we'd prefer to revert back
to the previous independent queue method of testing. It
has served us well.
Change-Id: I62152f7407a4f6737a8bdba0f1af557f8302746c

openstack%2Fironic-python-agent~master~I005d85b7d8f84f5471db3c3da279c5cf9cf13d4e,openstack/ironic-python-agent,master,,I005d85b7d8f84f5471db3c3da279c5cf9cf13d4e,tox: Use the default version of Python 3 for tox tests,MERGED,2017-10-17 23:13:50.000000000,2017-10-23 16:14:14.000000000,2017-10-23 16:14:14.000000000,1,1,0,512900,4d1272b171c87e44f2a0ee94815cd351dafb1fb3,10,5,1,1,14760,John L. Villalovos,jlvillal,tox: Use the default version of Python 3 for tox tests
When running the tox tests, use the default version of Python 3. Instead
of having to update the Python 3 version as we move from
Just use the default version of Python 3 on the system.
This will not affect what gets run in the gate, as the version is
explicitly specified when it runs there. This is for developers who run
the tests locally.
Change-Id: I005d85b7d8f84f5471db3c3da279c5cf9cf13d4e

openstack%2Fnetworking-ovn~master~I8f0afb841e042f75e5062cca81717a3ecad17015,openstack/networking-ovn,master,bug/1605089,I8f0afb841e042f75e5062cca81717a3ecad17015,Simplify the L3 {create, update}_router() methods",MERGED,2017-10-11 15:17:39.000000000,2017-10-23 16:13:53.000000000,2017-10-23 16:13:53.000000000,133,90,8,511268,85c5f871a56bdaeaa3b8005b69765dea3f54ab59,32,7,9,6,6773,Lucas Alvares Gomes,lucasagomes,"Simplify the L3 {create, update}_router() methods
This patch is moving some of the logic from the {create,
update}_router() methods of the L3 driver into the OVNClient. In
summary, two things is being done in this patch:
* Remove the ""networks"" parameter from the {create, update}_router()
method in OVNClient. Now the list of network is fetched within these
methods.
* Remove the ""delta"" parameter from the update_router() method in
OVNClient. We are already passing the new and old version of the
router to that method, we know the differences we don't need to have
an extra parameter for it.
This patch is related to the work to that is being done at bug #1605089
which uses the OVNClient to recovery the resources that are out of sync
and by having OVNClient to handle the bulky work does simplify the
synchronization work.
Related-Bug: #1605089
Change-Id: I8f0afb841e042f75e5062cca81717a3ecad17015

openstack%2Fopenstack-ansible~master~Ie04dbbe2bdb7a9b0c5f4e4d9dc8006a1b7b9b558,openstack/openstack-ansible,master,hyperconverged,Ie04dbbe2bdb7a9b0c5f4e4d9dc8006a1b7b9b558,Hyper-converge our container usage,MERGED,2017-08-30 23:58:08.000000000,2017-10-23 15:58:45.000000000,2017-10-23 15:58:45.000000000,10,63,12,499396,1200ee1bee4a1fb2d682c0f73944f1b4d5902acd,48,9,9,6,7353,Kevin Carter,cloudnull,Hyper-converge our container usage
This change groups services into fewer containers. This does not
mix service categories so there's no worry of cross polluting a
different service with unknown packages and workloads. This only
minimizes the container types we have which reduces our resource
consumption and improves upgrade/deployment time.
Implements: spec Hyperconverged Containers
Change-Id: Ie04dbbe2bdb7a9b0c5f4e4d9dc8006a1b7b9b558
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

openstack%2Fopenstack-ansible-os_barbican~master~I69f0bb407482f716fac29400ca4d552ce2bfe810,openstack/openstack-ansible-os_barbican,master,zuulv3-jobs,I69f0bb407482f716fac29400ca4d552ce2bfe810,Remove unified queue from gate pipeline,MERGED,2017-10-23 10:15:52.000000000,2017-10-23 15:41:38.000000000,2017-10-23 15:41:38.000000000,0,1,0,514219,7486c0af49becf61d0a908d49f8ed686dd4c5a14,7,3,1,1,6816,Jesse Pretorius,jesse-pretorius,Remove unified queue from gate pipeline
Initially the intent for adding this was to better test
any patches for roles together before they merge, but it
has had the unintended side-effect of causing patches to
take much longer to merge (because they all get lined up
in a single queue, rather than independent queues) and
a lot more infra resources are used (because a patch
that fails at the top of the queue will result in all
subsequent patches restarting all their tests).
As discussed in the channel, we'd prefer to revert back
to the previous independent queue method of testing. It
has served us well.
Change-Id: I69f0bb407482f716fac29400ca4d552ce2bfe810

openstack%2Fwhereto~master~Id9ae6056b2248eacecfc19a7dec9480cf4193fd6,openstack/whereto,master,410-rules,Id9ae6056b2248eacecfc19a7dec9480cf4193fd6,fix test parsing for 410 tests,MERGED,2017-10-10 14:02:42.000000000,2017-10-23 15:36:35.000000000,2017-10-23 15:36:35.000000000,127,10,4,510895,18eb1ae36b0b9c31d08fc495b6261a009d8b3946,15,6,2,6,2472,Doug Hellmann,doug-hellmann,fix test parsing for 410 tests
Add a separate parsing function for test files that ensures all of the
tuples returned contain the same number of elements.
Update the test processing loop to stop when the match's target is None,
indicating that there is no new path and the response code is going
to be 410 or some other value that has no target path (i.e., the input
looks like ""redirectmatch 410 ^/nova/([^/]+)/man/nova-cert.html$"" so
there are only 3 fields instead of the usual 4 for other redirects).
Add missing tests that exposed these problems.
Change-Id: Id9ae6056b2248eacecfc19a7dec9480cf4193fd6
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

openstack%2Fpython-novaclient~master~Iafdecc90408fa948a13e83c05c38d65c8789f699,openstack/python-novaclient,master,bug/1533087,Iafdecc90408fa948a13e83c05c38d65c8789f699,Extra 'u' in the error message for nova commands,ABANDONED,2016-12-21 04:34:54.000000000,2017-10-23 15:33:20.000000000,,4,1,1,413403,c5d772eac70b6818412646c425b660d64ce852d3,16,6,2,1,24215,Akshil Verma,akshilv,Extra 'u' in the error message for nova commands
There is an extra 'u' in the error message when a wrong nova command
is executed. For example: ""nova abcd"" will show this result:
invalid choice: u'show1'"".
This issue occurs because the command-line arguments are utf-8
encoded, and the argparse.ArgumentParser is implemented in such a way
that it will typecast the error message as string and send it to the
error function.
Changed the error message displayed by removing the extra 'u'.
Change-Id: Iafdecc90408fa948a13e83c05c38d65c8789f699
Closes-Bug: 1533087

openstack%2Fnetworking-odl~master~If8e1cafd534e44835afede132fd8308d89d2b6c6,openstack/networking-odl,master,change/migrate_networking_odl_to_zuulv3,If8e1cafd534e44835afede132fd8308d89d2b6c6,Adding Zuul v3 migrated legacy jobs,MERGED,2017-10-17 13:01:40.000000000,2017-10-23 15:14:17.000000000,2017-10-19 07:24:38.000000000,2273,0,0,512608,849f92a13f9d7e155e0cd4016f72e0327a1e736e,15,5,2,27,26507,Michel Peterson,mpeterson,Adding Zuul v3 migrated legacy jobs

openstack%2Fheat~master~I502c8f9e0718558ae93ff5a568c1ef9ee17ca7f7,openstack/heat,master,,I502c8f9e0718558ae93ff5a568c1ef9ee17ca7f7,Unit tests: Remove deprecated oslo_db test case classes,MERGED,2017-10-19 22:12:09.000000000,2017-10-23 15:10:49.000000000,2017-10-23 15:10:49.000000000,28,20,0,513537,2382f46d4e209abd271fd32f45a9e8f95ad07231,9,4,1,1,4257,Zane Bitter,zaneb,Unit tests: Remove deprecated oslo_db test case classes

eliminates about 35 deprecation messages when running the unit tests.
Change-Id: I502c8f9e0718558ae93ff5a568c1ef9ee17ca7f7

openstack%2Fheat~master~I8a506c6b83801cc90ad2268875f848b6d73fdea6,openstack/heat,master,,I8a506c6b83801cc90ad2268875f848b6d73fdea6,Unit tests: Don't leave RPC server running,MERGED,2017-10-19 22:12:09.000000000,2017-10-23 15:10:47.000000000,2017-10-23 15:10:47.000000000,14,10,0,513536,23c62e30fbd25cc6d22920e77ad1da8f6d9b0b77,7,3,1,2,4257,Zane Bitter,zaneb,Unit tests: Don't leave RPC server running
Several tests started an RPC server (sometimes unnecessarily) and left it
running after the test had concluded. This resulted in messy logs
(""Exception in thread Thread-1 (most likely raised during interpreter
shutdown)"" and so on) in the console when the test worker exited. Avoid
these by either not starting the RPC server or ensuring it is stopped
before the end of the test.
Change-Id: I8a506c6b83801cc90ad2268875f848b6d73fdea6

openstack%2Fheat~master~Ic0465dc25235ea3b6ec56646df1cb57878faf748,openstack/heat,master,,Ic0465dc25235ea3b6ec56646df1cb57878faf748,Unit tests: ensure all threads complete,MERGED,2017-10-19 22:12:09.000000000,2017-10-23 15:10:46.000000000,2017-10-23 15:10:46.000000000,41,41,0,513535,3545caac56404e8ebe596f9ac11700f377b7c529,7,3,1,7,4257,Zane Bitter,zaneb,Unit tests: ensure all threads complete
A number of tests used to leave greenthreads that they had spawned running
beyond the end of the test. This fixes those tests to not start unnecessary
threads and/or to wait for all threads to complete before they finish.

openstack%2Fopenstack-ansible-openstack_openrc~master~I90a435c04f2f7ae339841e5c5c4cf95004e3f5d2,openstack/openstack-ansible-openstack_openrc,master,zuulv3-jobs,I90a435c04f2f7ae339841e5c5c4cf95004e3f5d2,Remove unified queue from gate pipeline,MERGED,2017-10-23 10:14:28.000000000,2017-10-23 15:07:35.000000000,2017-10-23 15:07:35.000000000,0,1,0,514217,df34a4f181002d8242283ecb76373bbf576644c9,7,3,1,1,6816,Jesse Pretorius,jesse-pretorius,Remove unified queue from gate pipeline
Initially the intent for adding this was to better test
any patches for roles together before they merge, but it
has had the unintended side-effect of causing patches to
take much longer to merge (because they all get lined up
in a single queue, rather than independent queues) and
a lot more infra resources are used (because a patch
that fails at the top of the queue will result in all
subsequent patches restarting all their tests).
As discussed in the channel, we'd prefer to revert back
to the previous independent queue method of testing. It
has served us well.
Change-Id: I90a435c04f2f7ae339841e5c5c4cf95004e3f5d2

openstack%2Fmistral~master~I816c8c2a940e38cf1698d76e1019671249238598,openstack/mistral,master,fix_scheduler_deletion,I816c8c2a940e38cf1698d76e1019671249238598,Fix deletion of delayed calls,MERGED,2017-10-23 07:09:16.000000000,2017-10-23 14:38:19.000000000,2017-10-23 11:49:16.000000000,22,0,0,514162,397a56278809fe1be62c55040042f310ca97b5e0,10,6,1,5,8731,Renat Akhmerov,rakhmerov,Fix deletion of delayed calls
* Deletion of delayed calls is incorrect. A list of delayed calls
gets deleted within one DB transaction and if at least one object
is not deleted because of a DBDeadlock exception (on MySQL) then
the entire transaction fails and, what's more important, the
exception is swallowed by the try-finally block without reraising
it so that it could be handled by the ""retry_on_deadlock"" decorator.
This patch fixes this problem by reraising the initial exception.
* Added ""retry_on_deadlock"" decorator to all methods methods that
open DB transactions and where we have a risk of hitting a deadlock.

openstack%2Fcharm-designate-bind~master~Icbe0cc790c565f125f0fe8c903e9b755fe764d7c,openstack/charm-designate-bind,master,bug/1722794,Icbe0cc790c565f125f0fe8c903e9b755fe764d7c,Implement ""dns-backend"" binding",MERGED,2017-10-12 15:27:07.000000000,2017-10-23 14:28:52.000000000,2017-10-23 14:28:52.000000000,5,2,2,511505,f514bb5a17690d95266d4b275a5ddc2cd1b3059e,27,5,7,2,24504,Tytus Kurek,tkurek,"Implement ""dns-backend"" binding
This patchset implements ""dns-backend"" binding which is required to
properly handle DNS zone transfers between designate and
desigante-bind applications. If ""dns-backend"" binding is provided
when deploying designate and designate-bind applications, DNZ zone
transfers will now take place over the subnet which belongs to the
provided space.

openstack%2Fpanko~master~Ibc6e6b31de87e61ff815499f226538db710d45d3,openstack/panko,master,jd/remove-dispatcher,Ibc6e6b31de87e61ff815499f226538db710d45d3,Remove deprecated Panko dispatcher,MERGED,2017-09-26 09:43:02.000000000,2017-10-23 13:43:42.000000000,2017-10-23 13:43:42.000000000,26,156,2,507456,2170159d2e244dacdb3f6375d6d9ce875adc2549,12,7,2,7,1669,Julien Danjou,jdanjou,Remove deprecated Panko dispatcher

openstack%2Fheat~master~I7e91a04fd4ae0be0c3d6de3cbc600a59653fd668,openstack/heat,master,,I7e91a04fd4ae0be0c3d6de3cbc600a59653fd668,Use new barbicanclient layout by default,ABANDONED,2017-10-19 22:12:09.000000000,2017-10-23 13:43:12.000000000,,3,2,0,513538,bbf83e8a5da5e9923fca9ac1cf2fc49302d08635,4,2,1,1,4257,Zane Bitter,zaneb,Use new barbicanclient layout by default
Since version 4.5.0, barbicanclient has moved its modules into a v1
submodule. (Since version 4.5.1, those modules are lazily-loadable from the
old path also.) Use the new layout by default to avoid the deprecation
warning, and fall back to the old one since we still support client
versions back to 4.0.0 in requirements.txt, rather than vice-versa.
Change-Id: I7e91a04fd4ae0be0c3d6de3cbc600a59653fd668

openstack%2Fopenstack-zuul-jobs~master~I9d0b2ffb1734da11c7e362c10bd2e4c643805d13,openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs,master,ara-sqlite-middleware,I9d0b2ffb1734da11c7e362c10bd2e4c643805d13,Add missing required-projects for puppet-openstackci,MERGED,2017-10-21 13:17:48.000000000,2017-10-23 13:37:01.000000000,2017-10-23 13:37:01.000000000,15,180,0,513930,8a54be76a37bedb2705abbe3541ef86718b3d6e8,7,3,1,1,9061,David Moreau Simard,dmsimard,Add missing required-projects for puppet-openstackci
This unifies the beaker and openstackci puppet rspec/beaker
jobs under a same base job for centralizing the required projects.
This resolves failing gate jobs for puppet-openstackci since it
uses system-config to install modules which, in turn, uses zuul-cloner.
We're also turning ""legacy-openstackci-beaker"" back to voting because
it has been shown to work properly with this set of required-projects.
Change-Id: I9d0b2ffb1734da11c7e362c10bd2e4c643805d13

openstack%2Fironic-python-agent~master~I5188112f06dcfda4f5b0fd41fa9b9dd270cde8d7,openstack/ironic-python-agent,master,,I5188112f06dcfda4f5b0fd41fa9b9dd270cde8d7,Have unit tests all derive from our base unit test class,MERGED,2017-10-18 18:09:30.000000000,2017-10-23 13:36:38.000000000,2017-10-23 13:36:38.000000000,26,26,0,513155,265a072b7297b1516eb0db7f9eb821518b68a725,7,3,1,10,14760,John L. Have our unit tests derive from the base unit test class in
ironic_python_agent/tests/unit/base: IronicAgentTest
This is so if we add additional global common features to our base
test class, all of our tests will get those common features.
Change-Id: I5188112f06dcfda4f5b0fd41fa9b9dd270cde8d7

openstack%2Fceilometer~master~I96887bdb7df41fa4e5998f3d54325cf6c083b5e8,openstack/ceilometer,master,,I96887bdb7df41fa4e5998f3d54325cf6c083b5e8,Reduced the complexity of the SingleColumnValueFilter method,ABANDONED,2017-07-17 08:22:09.000000000,2017-10-23 12:52:41.000000000,,9,18,1,484282,4889f01c3ee1c8be187878a52b5e4a79dba113c5,6,4,1,1,18603,Béla Vancsics,vancsics,Reduced the complexity of the SingleColumnValueFilter method
The SingleColumnValueFilter's cyclomatic complexity is large.
(McCabe's Cyclomatic Complexity: 21)
http://openqa.sed.hu/dashboard/index/16761?sm_resource=18231#
I extracted some of the functionalities into helper functions
to reduce the complexity. Additionally it became more readable
as well, without changing its functionality.
Change-Id: I96887bdb7df41fa4e5998f3d54325cf6c083b5e8

openstack%2Fbandit~master~I8d368aea287e1287e5f638b48c4297d355037839,openstack/bandit,master,bug/1708582,I8d368aea287e1287e5f638b48c4297d355037839,Plugin to flag insecure hash functions created using hashlib.new(),MERGED,2017-09-16 01:35:37.000000000,2017-10-23 11:03:43.000000000,2017-10-23 11:03:43.000000000,91,0,5,504544,a98519927be935eb6f331226c1fcc272822d4a68,44,7,6,5,14758,Rajath Agasthya,rajathagasthya,Plugin to flag insecure hash functions created using hashlib.new()
Currently, insecure hash function usage by calling hashlib.md5()
is flagged in B303. But these hash functions can also be obtained using
hashlib.new(), by passing 'md4' or 'md5' as an argument. This plugin
checks such usage.
Closes-Bug: #1708582

openstack%2Fnova~stable%2Focata~I6b9eb120b6e7fcbf919a3791afe2d1f6a7bd3b60,openstack/nova,stable/ocata,multi-cell-testing-stable/ocata,I6b9eb120b6e7fcbf919a3791afe2d1f6a7bd3b60,Target context for build notification in conductor,MERGED,2017-10-11 19:41:18.000000000,2017-10-23 10:50:53.000000000,2017-10-23 10:50:53.000000000,21,6,0,511325,d7a60f8a1c51070237590d975b1acc61f4bbcfca,42,11,1,2,4690,melanie witt,melwitt,Target context for build notification in conductor
When sending notifications about an instance, it's possible the
notification payload will have attributes not already loaded on
the instance. In this case, a lazy-load will happen and if the
load method needs to lookup the instance (example: in the
_check_instance_exists_in_project method in the DB layer), the
InstanceNotFound exception will be raised and the notification
will fail to be sent.
This targets the instance context to the instance's cell when
calling the send notification method.
Closes-Bug: #1721670
Conflicts:
nova/conductor/manager.py
nova/tests/unit/conductor/test_conductor.py
NOTE(melwitt): Conflict was due to the older version of target_cell
not yielding a new RequestContext, the absence of set_target_cell,
and an older version of the unit test in Ocata.
Change-Id: I6b9eb120b6e7fcbf919a3791afe2d1f6a7bd3b60
(cherry picked from commit 54cf9f5a90d745896d133669e6d1260e6adee51b)

openstack%2Fnova~stable%2Focata~I5c1713195585ac9cf34a8f9fc6b5a61afe996034,openstack/nova,stable/ocata,multi-cell-testing-stable/ocata,I5c1713195585ac9cf34a8f9fc6b5a61afe996034,Make conductor create InstanceAction in the proper cell,MERGED,2017-10-11 17:25:16.000000000,2017-10-23 10:50:49.000000000,2017-10-23 10:50:49.000000000,16,4,0,511307,014effb11ec28482bd58158ac6033756e82a246c,34,12,1,2,6873,Matt Riedemann,mriedem,Make conductor create InstanceAction in the proper cell
Conductor was not creating the InstanceAction in the appropriate

Change-Id: I5c1713195585ac9cf34a8f9fc6b5a61afe996034
(cherry picked from commit ca51db7e2db72cb774c94fb039509f2b4e6c94ca)

openstack%2Fnova~stable%2Fpike~Idf20fb435a7d11ff93bcb137699a38f5e4562d4c,openstack/nova,stable/pike,bug/1715182,Idf20fb435a7d11ff93bcb137699a38f5e4562d4c,Add live.migration.force.complete to the legacy notification whitelist,MERGED,2017-10-02 13:21:41.000000000,2017-10-23 10:50:44.000000000,2017-10-23 10:50:44.000000000,23,14,0,508877,c82fc7d43e8480f1fc99125cad52e9fc3db33ed3,58,14,3,2,6873,Matt Riedemann,mriedem,Add live.migration.force.complete to the legacy notification whitelist

openstack%2Ftripleo-heat-templates~stable%2Fpike~I5e43e8fd61e002d2acc56a7de52e6aae64ab60be,openstack/tripleo-heat-templates,stable/pike,bug/1723163-stable/pike,I5e43e8fd61e002d2acc56a7de52e6aae64ab60be,Disable xinetd class when creating swift-storage puppet configuration,MERGED,2017-10-19 03:31:58.000000000,2017-10-23 10:29:58.000000000,2017-10-23 10:29:58.000000000,4,1,0,513242,d8c7fc05305fc52b0042d52990f16124a04756a5,21,3,1,1,3153,Emilien Macchi,emilienm,Disable xinetd class when creating swift-storage puppet configuration
Due to missing puppet invocation with --detailed-exitcodes we ignored
a large amount of puppet errors during deploy. Swift storage fails
during the puppet_config step with the following error:

Debug: /Stage[main]/Swift::Storage::Object/Swift::Storage::Generic[object]/Package[swift-object]: Not tagged with file, file_line, concat, augeas, cron, swif t_proxy_config, swift_config, swift_container_config, swift_container_sync_realms_config, swift_account_config, swift_object_config, swift_object_expirer_con fig, rsync::server
Debug: /Stage[main]/Swift::Storage::Object/Swift::Storage::Generic[object]/Package[swift-object]: Resource is being skipped, unscheduling all events
Debug: Executing: '/usr/bin/systemctl is-active xinetd'
Debug: Executing: '/usr/bin/systemctl is-enabled xinetd'
Debug: Executing: '/usr/bin/systemctl unmask xinetd'
Debug: Executing: '/usr/bin/systemctl start xinetd'
Debug: Runing journalctl command to get logs for systemd start failure: journalctl -n 50 --since '5 minutes ago' -u xinetd --no-pager
Debug: Executing: 'journalctl -n 50 --since '5 minutes ago' -u xinetd --no-pager'
Error: Systemd start for xinetd failed!
The problem is that by using the rsync::server tag we end up including
the xinetd class automatically which will try to start a service inside
a container. By nooping the xinetd class, we're able avoid systemctl
calls and have a successfuly deployment. The resulting swift_rsync
container seems to work correctly:
[root@overcloud-controller-0 ~]# docker exec -it swift_rsync /bin/bash -c ""ps -axuwf""
USER       PID %CPU %MEM    VSZ   RSS TTY      STAT START   TIME COMMAND
root         1  0.0  0.0    188     4 ?        Ss   17:27   0:00 /usr/local/bin/dumb-init /bin/bash /usr/local/bin/kolla_start
root         6  0.0  0.0  11036   924 ?        Ss   17:27   0:00 /usr/bin/rsync --daemon --no-detach --config=/etc/rsyncd.conf
[root@overcloud-controller-0 ~]# docker logs swift_rsync 2>&1
INFO:__main__:Deleting /etc/rsyncd.conf
INFO:__main__:Copying /var/lib/kolla/config_files/src/etc/rsyncd.conf to /etc/rsyncd.conf
INFO:__main__:Writing out command to execute
Running command: '/usr/bin/rsync --daemon --no-detach --config=/etc/rsyncd.conf'
Change-Id: I5e43e8fd61e002d2acc56a7de52e6aae64ab60be
Closes-Bug: #1723463
(cherry picked from commit b5eeeab73e12efecc86ea7deebc105eee0739510)

openstack%2Fcharm-interface-bind-rndc~master~I927e3958cf929ace9d43f8b3d9509b90b9eab60f,openstack/charm-interface-bind-rndc,master,bug/1722794,I927e3958cf929ace9d43f8b3d9509b90b9eab60f,Implement ""dns-backend"" binding",MERGED,2017-10-12 18:27:47.000000000,2017-10-23 10:18:22.000000000,2017-10-23 10:18:22.000000000,7,0,5,511547,086a3a7b2576d02d580532859b6d410642a0e8e2,14,6,2,2,24504,Tytus Kurek,tkurek,"Implement ""dns-backend"" binding
This patchset implements ""dns-backend"" binding which is required to
properly handle DNS zone transfers between designate and
desigante-bind applications. If ""dns-backend"" binding is provided
when deploying designate and designate-bind applications, DNZ zone
transfers will now take place over the subnet which belongs to the
provided space.
Change-Id: I927e3958cf929ace9d43f8b3d9509b90b9eab60f
Partial-Bug: #1722794

openstack%2Fbarbican~master~I2f13b495a6b45e226e0742291f76ee88dbcf52df,openstack/barbican,master,bug/1726203,I2f13b495a6b45e226e0742291f76ee88dbcf52df,Fix Race Condition in get_or_create_project(),MERGED,2017-10-23 02:23:28.000000000,2017-10-23 09:10:41.000000000,2017-10-23 09:10:41.000000000,9,1,0,514103,71829664b2ac4547c54940ad62bd8d0123f6e422,8,6,1,1,11561,Dave McCowan,dave-mccowan,Fix Race Condition in get_or_create_project()
get_or_create_project() first calls a get (query of the database).
If that fails, then it calls create.  The issues is when
there are two threads and both fail the original get, then
each will call create.  One of those creates will fail, resulting
in the traceback.
One way to protect this critical region is to call create first,
then if that fails, call get.
In this case, get_or_create_project() is called for every
Barbican API operation.  The create action (which is slow), happens
once per project for the life of the cloud.  The get action happens
every other time.  For performance gains, I left call get first,
since that call succeeds almost always.
Change-Id: I2f13b495a6b45e226e0742291f76ee88dbcf52df
Closes-bug: #1726203

openstack%2Fcharm-specs~master~I829b7f2e8facf4b2d871ecd48380216887f13bee,openstack/charm-specs,master,bug/1704769,I829b7f2e8facf4b2d871ecd48380216887f13bee,Designate - Neutron integration,MERGED,2017-08-31 13:12:08.000000000,2017-10-23 08:34:32.000000000,2017-10-23 08:34:32.000000000,205,0,17,499590,e792b2d0a8cf4fab610ec38c22ff79a8f48cad1a,16,4,4,1,24504,Tytus Kurek,tkurek,Designate - Neutron integration
This patchset defines a spec for Designate - Neutron integration via
extension_drivers. It introduces a new relation (""external-dns"")
between designate and neutron-api charms, and a new interface
(""designate"") which is used by this relation. Additional config
options on neutron-api charm side are introduced as well.
Change-Id: I829b7f2e8facf4b2d871ecd48380216887f13bee
Related-Bug: #1704769

openstack%2Fopenstack-ansible~master~I44fa2b0e5b62f632c4b2fe2cc453d08692d97544,openstack/openstack-ansible,master,dynamic_grouping,I44fa2b0e5b62f632c4b2fe2cc453d08692d97544,Move dynamic grouping conditional,MERGED,2017-10-13 21:42:35.000000000,2017-10-23 08:30:41.000000000,2017-10-23 08:30:41.000000000,4,4,0,511967,c1bcb9e9226cd573db6fd64ab2c61a9ff2225be0,15,6,2,2,14805,Jimmy McCrory,jimmy-mccrory,Move dynamic grouping conditional
Instead of using a when clause around the inclusion of the
dynamic-grouping task, use a new var, 'group_when' that's only applied
within the task. This will avoid checking localhost for a hostvar which
doesn't actually apply and may not exist.
Change-Id: I44fa2b0e5b62f632c4b2fe2cc453d08692d97544

openstack%2Fopenstack-ansible-os_neutron~stable%2Focata~I1edfae74fc62d523d670bf5932587aa6626512d2,openstack/openstack-ansible-os_neutron,stable/ocata,fix_os_neutron_developer_mode,I1edfae74fc62d523d670bf5932587aa6626512d2,Add git and iptables to the list of packages,MERGED,2017-10-17 13:58:38.000000000,2017-10-23 07:47:52.000000000,2017-10-23 07:47:52.000000000,15,0,0,512630,44f606f7b15cf33c0e25143ef6a3b099372f207b,14,5,1,4,17068,Jean-Philippe Evrard,evrardjp,Add git and iptables to the list of packages
1) When doing an upper branch upgrade test (anything above Ocata), we
clone previous branch, and run a playbook that targets this previous
branch. It's not possible to merge anything with the upgrade job
failing.
2) The upgrade jobs are currently failing in neutron, because pip install
in the role, for the developer mode, requires git and pip installed
INSIDE the container. We therefore need to add git to the list of packages
to install [1]
3) Similarily, iptables need to be installed on all the agents, so
we add it to the list of the packages to install. However, it's
also needed before the first neutron role executes in an upgrade,
and therefore needs an edit in the play calling the previous role:
tests/test-install-previous-neutron.yml
Collecting neutron from git+https:
//git.openstack.org/openstack/neutron@stable/pike#egg=neutron
(from -c /opt/developer-pip-constraints.txt (line 1))
Error [Errno 2] No such file or directory while executing command
git clone -q https://git.openstack.org/openstack/neutron
/tmp/pip-build-Lk_L35/neutron
Cannot find command 'git'
Change-Id: I1edfae74fc62d523d670bf5932587aa6626512d2
Co-Authored-By: Manuel Buil <mbuil@suse.com>

openstack%2Fmanila~master~I6d9dec56890fb3a9bc0539c45c43233517cea048,openstack/manila,master,doc,I6d9dec56890fb3a9bc0539c45c43233517cea048,doc: move stuff from contributor to admin,MERGED,2017-09-28 13:30:52.000000000,2017-10-23 07:41:56.000000000,2017-10-19 20:32:19.000000000,35,44,8,508157,a149c283d7701760e5b8040f6daea3965ae11d3a,41,18,3,22,9003,Tom Barron,tbarron,doc: move stuff from contributor to admin

openstack%2Fnova~stable%2Fpike~Icbd5d7ff41aa04f8f7934fdce9668762691a4a69,openstack/nova,stable/pike,bug/1715182,Icbd5d7ff41aa04f8f7934fdce9668762691a4a69,Add recreate test for live migrate rollback not cleaning up dest allocs,MERGED,2017-10-05 22:21:34.000000000,2017-10-23 07:37:07.000000000,2017-10-23 07:37:07.000000000,71,0,0,509923,81c4c17f2a0b9cd3a4d27c0b06092ef456c8979f,15,8,1,1,6873,Matt Riedemann,mriedem,Add recreate test for live migrate rollback not cleaning up dest allocs
We rollback from a failed live migration in two cases:
1. The pre_live_migration on the destination host fails. The
_do_live_migration method calls _rollback_live_migration
explicitly to cleanup the dest host.
2. The live migration in the virt driver fails, and the virt driver
calls back to _rollback_live_migration in the ComputeManager.
Either way, the instance is not on the destination host, so just like
how we remove volume connections and unplug vifs from the destination
host, we need to also remove allocations for the destination node in
Placement.
This change adds a test to show that we are not currently cleaning up
allocations on the destination node when we rollback from a live
migration failure.
Change-Id: Icbd5d7ff41aa04f8f7934fdce9668762691a4a69
Related-Bug: #1715182
(cherry picked from commit 6c3a58ce8001c588fe225d60ec198c7141d74700)

openstack%2Fnova~stable%2Fpike~Idc011a8aa4b1aa9b35e793913e43e9835d5d08f2,openstack/nova,stable/pike,bug/1715182,Idc011a8aa4b1aa9b35e793913e43e9835d5d08f2,Add _wait_for_action_fail_completion to InstanceHelperMixin,MERGED,2017-10-05 22:21:34.000000000,2017-10-23 07:37:03.000000000,2017-10-23 07:37:03.000000000,41,74,0,509922,6baf3904e742c5dc5aa38a1b64fd00fa706ecd63,16,9,1,2,6873,Matt Riedemann,mriedem,Add _wait_for_action_fail_completion to InstanceHelperMixin
This moves two nearly identical utility methods into the
InstanceHelperMixin for waiting for an instance action failure

Change-Id: Idc011a8aa4b1aa9b35e793913e43e9835d5d08f2
(cherry picked from commit 4763dd86bf8940e81159772965ec496c6f829748)

openstack%2Fnova~stable%2Focata~Ie278ca58c371b8e3bd4861e6c86ebcf30c6778ea,openstack/nova,stable/ocata,bug/1717943-stable/ocata,Ie278ca58c371b8e3bd4861e6c86ebcf30c6778ea,Account for compute.metrics.update in legacy notification whitelist,MERGED,2017-10-04 13:25:57.000000000,2017-10-23 07:36:56.000000000,2017-10-23 07:36:56.000000000,18,5,0,509440,1c88f3f75d827610be925f68b076253dba76cfcc,12,9,1,2,6873,Matt Riedemann,mriedem,Account for compute.metrics.update in legacy notification whitelist
The compute.metrics.update legacy unversioned notification was missing
from the whitelist because the only test for it was mocking out the
rpc notifier call, which is what validates the entries in the whitelist.
This adds the entry to the whitelist and fixes the test to actually
use the notifier code.
Change-Id: Ie278ca58c371b8e3bd4861e6c86ebcf30c6778ea
Closes-Bug: #1717943
(cherry picked from commit 963bf956ce93ba02bf9f38f979fe914d090b76d4)

openstack%2Fneutron~master~Ib2227e332c52d2f7225c41f57108c38641348183,openstack/neutron,master,bug/1724138,Ib2227e332c52d2f7225c41f57108c38641348183,create_security_group: Expunge an object selectively,MERGED,2017-10-17 09:42:10.000000000,2017-10-23 07:12:19.000000000,2017-10-21 00:55:40.000000000,2,1,0,512564,2a7cf9a97476ab1e56c5b3724b0d60cc29e7db1f,18,6,3,1,6854,YAMAMOTO Takashi,yamamoto,create_security_group: Expunge an object selectively
This expunge_all() can detach unrelated DB objects.  Especially
it can have wider effects with surrounding transactions, used by
some of service plugins like networking-midonet L3 plugin.
The problem was exposed by the recent OVO change [1] on
networking-midonet gate jobs.
Closes-Bug: #1724138

openstack%2Fheat~master~I4ac7ac88797b7fb14046b5668649b2277ee55517,openstack/heat,master,bug/1722371,I4ac7ac88797b7fb14046b5668649b2277ee55517,Retrigger new traversals after resource timeout,MERGED,2017-10-05 22:17:56.000000000,2017-10-23 07:08:34.000000000,2017-10-23 07:08:34.000000000,15,8,1,509921,bb330ae1a6c907ec2a8b8c198b7268d0abec3b43,29,5,6,3,4257,Zane Bitter,zaneb,Retrigger new traversals after resource timeout
If a resource times out, we still need to check whether there is a new
traversal underway that we need to retrigger, otherwise the new traversal
will never complete.
Closes-Bug: #1721654

openstack%2Fheat~master~Idde65b2d41490ab8318b5a8b95ea74e9b96b4e5c,openstack/heat,master,bug/1722371,Idde65b2d41490ab8318b5a8b95ea74e9b96b4e5c,Make scheduler.Timeout exception hashable,MERGED,2017-10-18 20:48:35.000000000,2017-10-23 07:08:32.000000000,2017-10-23 07:08:32.000000000,8,15,0,513181,6a9672a26443c901f4a465c86992ecece3f73bbd,12,4,1,2,4257,Zane Bitter,zaneb,Make scheduler.Timeout exception hashable
The python standard library in Python 3.6.3 and earlier has a bug with
handling unhashable exceptions: https://bugs.python.org/issue28603
Although oslo_log will catch the error, make scheduler.Timeout hashable so
that all exceptions will be printable.
Prior to 640abe0c12e63c207fcf67592838f112a29f5b43 we just used __cmp__(),
but that isn't used in Python 3. Defining __eq__(), which is required for
the total_ordering decorator, makes the class unhashable in Python 3.
Change-Id: Idde65b2d41490ab8318b5a8b95ea74e9b96b4e5c
Related-Bug: #1724366
Related-Bug: #1721654

openstack%2Fheat~master~I5cb0cfd6bb05a94cd32709b5cda8454df6e81a61,openstack/heat,master,bug/1722371,I5cb0cfd6bb05a94cd32709b5cda8454df6e81a61,Add integration tests for simultaneous updates,MERGED,2017-10-05 18:21:12.000000000,2017-10-23 07:08:31.000000000,2017-10-23 07:08:31.000000000,83,0,2,509864,fe45b745e5f0a859f10b6edf2ad8f1e24cc01a56,29,5,6,1,4257,Zane Bitter,zaneb,Add integration tests for simultaneous updates
Convergence allows us to start a stack update while a previous update (or
create) is still in progress. If a resource is found to be locked by a
previous graph traversal when the new traversal comes to update it, the
earlier traversal is responsible for retriggering the resource after it
completes.
This patch adds functional tests to confirm that this works when the
long-running resource update ends in success or failure (as opposed to
timing out or being cancelled).
Change-Id: I5cb0cfd6bb05a94cd32709b5cda8454df6e81a61

openstack%2Fneutron~master~I629eeff905bf02ec5f7ee68cccc7c19f1b47d5aa,openstack/neutron,master,bug/1723848,I629eeff905bf02ec5f7ee68cccc7c19f1b47d5aa,Notify port_update to agent for status change,MERGED,2017-10-16 06:10:21.000000000,2017-10-23 06:25:59.000000000,2017-10-20 20:36:57.000000000,12,0,5,512179,4f9a6a8b7661c3792101580d14d401e8426bf72a,20,15,1,2,10267,venkata anil,anil,Notify port_update to agent for status change
Notify agents about port update when ""port_update"" is called to update
port's status change. L3 agent will spawn keepalived only when HA
network port status is ACTIVE. When L3 agent is restarted, it sets HA
network port status to DOWN (through ""port_update""), with the assumption
that L2 agent will again rewire the port (set status to ACTIVE) allowing
L3 agent to spawn keepalived. As server is not notifying L2 agent, port
is remaining in DOWN status and L3 agent was never spawning keepalived
on L3 agent restart(if keepalived is killed).
Closes-Bug: 1723848
Change-Id: I629eeff905bf02ec5f7ee68cccc7c19f1b47d5aa
